verses.text: Now when the adversaries of Judah and Benjamin heard that the children of the captivity builded the temple unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel ;\f + \fr 4.1 \ft the children…: Heb. the sons of the transportation\f*

Then they came to Zerubbabel , and to the chief of the fathers , and said unto them, Let us build with you: for we seek your God , as ye \add do;\add* and we do sacrifice unto him since the days of Esar-haddon king of Assur , which brought us up hither.

But Zerubbabel , and Jeshua , and the rest of the chief of the fathers of Israel , said unto them, Ye have nothing to do with us to build an house unto our God ; but we ourselves together will build unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel , as king Cyrus the king of Persia hath commanded us.
Then the people of the land weakened the hands of the people of Judah , and troubled them in building ,
And hired counsellors against them, to frustrate their purpose , all the days of Cyrus king of Persia , even until the reign of Darius king of Persia. \p

And in the reign of Ahasuerus , in the beginning of his reign , wrote they \add unto him\add* an accusation against the inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem.\f + \fr 4.6 \ft Ahasuerus: Heb. Ahashverosh\f* \p

¶ And in the days of Artaxerxes wrote Bishlam , Mithredath , Tabeel , and the rest of their companions , unto Artaxerxes king of Persia ; and the writing of the letter \add was\add* written in the Syrian tongue , and interpreted in the Syrian tongue.\f + \fr 4.7 \ft Bishlam: or, in peace\f*\f + \fr 4.7 \ft companions: Heb. societies\f*
Rehum the chancellor and Shimshai the scribe wrote a letter against Jerusalem to Artaxerxes the king in this sort :\f + \fr 4.8 \ft scribe: or, secretary\f*

Then \add wrote\add* Rehum the chancellor , and Shimshai the scribe , and the rest of their companions ; the Dinaites , the Apharsathchites , the Tarpelites , the Apharsites , the Archevites , the Babylonians , the Susanchites , the Dehavites , \add and\add* the Elamites ,\f + \fr 4.9 \ft companions: Chaldee, societies\f*

And the rest of the nations whom the great and noble Asnappar brought over , and set in the cities of Samaria , and the rest \add that are\add* on this side the river , and at such a time.\f + \fr 4.10 \ft at such…: Chaldee, Cheeneth\f* \p
¶ This \add is\add* the copy of the letter that they sent unto him , \add even\add* unto Artaxerxes the king ; Thy servants the men on this side the river , and at such a time.

Be it known unto the king , that the Jews which came up from thee to us are come unto Jerusalem , building the rebellious and the bad city , and have set up the walls \add thereof\add*, and joined the foundations.\f + \fr 4.12 \ft set up: or, finished\f*\f + \fr 4.12 \ft joined: Chaldee, sewed together\f*

Be it known now unto the king , that, if this city be builded , and the walls set up \add again, then\add* will they not pay toll , tribute , and custom , and \add so\add* thou shalt endamage the revenue of the kings.\f + \fr 4.13 \ft pay: Chaldee, give\f*\f + \fr 4.13 \ft revenue: or, strength\f*

Now because we have maintenance from \add the king’s\add* palace , and it was not meet for us to see the king’s dishonour , therefore have we sent and certified the king ;\f + \fr 4.14 \ft we have…: Chaldee, we are salted with the salt of the palace\f*

That search may be made in the book of the records of thy fathers : so shalt thou find in the book of the records , and know that this city \add is\add* a rebellious city , and hurtful unto kings and provinces , and that they have moved sedition within the same of old time : for which cause was this city destroyed. \f + \fr 4.15 \ft moved: Chaldee, made\f*\f + \fr 4.15 \ft within…: Chaldee, in the midst thereof\f*
We certify the king that, if this city be builded \add again\add*, and the walls thereof set up , by this means thou shalt have no portion on this side the river. \p

¶ \add Then\add* sent the king an answer unto Rehum the chancellor , and \add to\add* Shimshai the scribe , and \add to\add* the rest of their companions that dwell in Samaria , and \add unto\add* the rest beyond the river , Peace , and at such a time.\f + \fr 4.17 \ft companions: Chaldee, societies\f*
The letter which ye sent unto us hath been plainly read before me.

And I commanded , and search hath been made, and it is found that this city of old time hath made insurrection against kings , and \add that\add* rebellion and sedition have been made therein.\f + \fr 4.19 \ft I commanded: Chaldee, by me a decree is set\f*\f + \fr 4.19 \ft made insurrection: Chaldee, lifted up itself\f*
There have been mighty kings also over Jerusalem , which have ruled over all \add countries\add* beyond the river ; and toll , tribute , and custom , was paid unto them.
Give ye now commandment to cause these men to cease , and that this city be not builded , until \add another\add* commandment shall be given from me.\f + \fr 4.21 \ft Give…: Chaldee, Make a decree\f*
Take heed now that ye fail not to do this : why should damage grow to the hurt of the kings ? \p

¶ Now when the copy of king Artaxerxes’ letter \add was\add* read before Rehum , and Shimshai the scribe , and their companions , they went up in haste to Jerusalem unto the Jews , and made them to cease by force and power.\f + \fr 4.23 \ft by force…: Chaldee, by arm and power\f*
Then ceased the work of the house of God which \add is\add* at Jerusalem. So it ceased unto the second year of the reign of Darius king of Persia.
